text.name: system_description
text.text: The Sega System SP, is an arcade board developed by Sega which first entered service in 2004. It can be seen as a cost-reduced NAOMI board (itself derived from the Sega Dreamcast), where the core components are presented as a system-on-a-chip, a bespoke version of Linux is used as an operating system, and software was distributed on CompactFlash cards instead of GD-ROMs or cartridges.
